title: Can spirituality and sensuality coexist? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. The CS Lewis quote from the Weight of Glory recognizes this to be true: …it would seem that Our Lord finds our desires not too strong, but too weak. We are half-hearted creatures, fooling about with drink and sex and ambition when infinite joy is offered us, like an ignorant child who wants to go on making mud pies in a slum because he cannot imagine what is meant by the offer of a holiday at the sea. We are far too easily pleased. (26) Thats a quote you can mentally wrestle with and reflect on for quite some time. And, the key aspect of sensuality that Christianity speaks to is the issue of commitment. Commitment points to a deeper issue in the ethical life and in the life of wisdom which our modern life unfortunately neglects. The larger emphasis on the importance of commitment in terms of living great lives is echoed in David Brook’s commencement speech at Dartmouth:  This spoken word speaks to the larger issue of Our Counterfeit Gods:  It goes a second step. Any understanding of the message of the Bible that doesn’t include the cross is missing its key central piece—its literally and figuratively missing the very heart of the message. All of this points to the question of the cross. Humans are imperfect. Humans can find freedom in Christ—freedom from sin, freedom from idolatry, freedom from addiction in Christ and Christ alone.

As your presence is experienced as a blessing for countless others, so too would your absence be missed quite significantly. We can experience the blessing that is you … because of sex. Since both spirituality and sensuality exist it's not a question of if they can coexist but how. All possibilities exist. All possibilities coexist. All possibilities arise as opposites. No possibility can arise without its opposite. Yin cannot arise without yang. Matter cannot arise without antimatter. Something cannot arise without nothing. "The opposites, while separate in reality are together in their possibility." (Aristotle). So the question is, How do opposites coexist? The ancient Greeks called this coexistence, Adikia which roughly translates as the war of the opposites. Alchemists saw it as a ceaseless re-balancing signified by Libra's uneven scales. The I Ching sees the opposites switching sides. This is signified by the solid line becoming the broken line and vice versa. In my opinion these are all primitive accommodations. Eventually the opposites evolve into the enlightened coexistence known as Democracy. This is not an offhand metaphor. The founders of the United States were enlightened. Even the name they gave this country, “United States,” proclaims this. In a democracy the opposites, thesis and antithesis, work together to form a synthesis. God is a democratic synthesis of all possible opposites. God is both spiritual and sensual. The synthesis of the opposites is intensely sensual for God just as democratic governance is for its citizens. In Hinduism this Godly union of spirituality and sensuality is called Yab Yum.

Spirituality concerns aspects of the spirit and the process of evolving to higher spiritual awareness. Sensuality is that which appeals to the senses. When any spirit incorporates into any physical organism, it acquires sensuality. They not only can co-exist, but must. For only thru sensuality can spirit appreciate any incorporation. The real issue here is to attain balance and not allow sensuality to become addictive and thus blind the spirit to avenues of higher vibrational awareness. Not easy to do as sensual pleasure is extremely addictive. However, it also comes with a higher cost of pain as well. Moderation is the best path to follow in binding together the co-existence of spirit and sensuality.

Most definitely! I’m 20 years old (so a college student). I have no shortage of wild weekends, and yet, I’m living in the spiritual 24/7. Do not think of the spiritual as separate from the sensual. Think of them like Russain Nesting Dolls in which spirituality is the bigger doll that contains the smaller doll of sensuality within it. In other words, experiencing sensuality doesn’t mean you have to sacrifice spiritual experience. If you reach a high enough level of spirituality, you see the depth and meaning of the Universe in the most mundane things (even trash laying out on the street and the very rocks beneath your feet). With that said, I have never lost touch with the spiritual, even while partying. Now like I said, this takes a high level of spirituality to achieve (the past 9 years of my life has been continuous spiritual experiences one after the other and yet they’re all blended into one “instant”). So for people who are starting out, they may find it beneficial to focus more on spirituality than on sensuality. At least until they attain a level of focus where attention to one can be included within attention to the other, like the Russian Nesting Dolls.

One of the most powerful ways to experience your spiritual essence is through delving deeply into the feelings provided by the senses. Whether it be pleasure or pain, the senses are an avenue to feel the self. Just as releasing a current understanding to a deeper contemplation can expand your awareness, giving your all to a particular sensation will open up a universe of space and bliss. An obvious example would be the how the small self is lost at the height of sensual pleasure. At climax, there is no me, there is only the feeling of blissful being, enjoyed by the body, experienced in the mind. Another example is the feeling that a song can give, when you totally lose yourself in it. For me it is listening to Pat Metheny’s soaring guitar that transports me beyond the body, or dancing to certain dance/house songs where I lose the sensation of having a body, and become just free beingness. When spirituality can be seen to thrive beyond the confines of sitting in meditation and other traditional settings, it expands, and the goal can be experienced in any sensual activity. Then you are really in tune with and expressing the inner being we all share.

Basically, consciousness just is. It cannot even be labelled by the words we give to things in this third dimension. Labels, genders, descriptions, all of these are just thoughts. That's not to say they aren’t necessary for the third dimension. The physical body needs some gender in order for the continuation of life on earth. It is also a dualistic world. One thing cannot exist without it's opposite. No thing can be without space yet space is nothing. Ask yourself, “Who am I?” and there shouldn't be an answer. I find this to be a handy exercise as I can experience my true self, infinite awareness if I had to label it. It's too difficult to put into words, it just is. That is all. I Am that I Am. I Am that awareness. And so, gender is necessary for reproduction and for the experience of duality, but ultimately does not exist. Duality can be transcended. That's one of the next steps for humanity.
